1. When do I launch?
  2. How do I rendezvous?
  3. How I dock?
  4. Is it the same on, say, the Mun, Minmus, Duna etc?

1 - As JaySmoka said, Usually when the Target is over KSC. I generally do it a little bit earlier, but thats just my preference.

2 - Set your Target as, the Target =P then get into a Orbit. Put either your AP [or PE] equal to your Targets, and your PE [or AP] about 10km below your Targets Orbit [start small when first learning, do not go larger or you'll miss windows].

* After each Orbit you both do, you'll see that your Close Encounter Marker on the Map will get smaller and smaller.

* When the Encounter is around 1 - 2km [lower if possible] then equal out your PE with your Targets Orbit, so you're both Orbiting the same.

* Once your Orbits are on the same paths, the easiest way to do it is to burn [slowly] towards your Target. You want to get your Prograde Marker on the Target Marker [Watch your Speed though] At close distances, you do not want to come crashing into it!] Travel at about 10 - 30m/s depending on your distance.

* When you get within 50 - 100m Burn Retrograde to take your speed down even more. 5 - 10m/s.

* Feel free to slow down whenever you start feeling a "oh sht" moment come along though =]

3 - Once you have reached your Target at about 5 - 10m, you want to make sure your not traveling away or towards the Target. Once you have stabilized that, Target which ever Docking Port you wish to Dock to.

* You want to use RCS Thrusters to align yourself with the Port you are heading for.

* Once you are aligned, then slowly start thrusting [with RCS] towards it. I would recommend no more than 2 - 3m/s until you get more comfortable.

* When you are almost connected, take your Speed down to 1m/s.

* Once you connect, it's best to not have ASAS on, but there is a trick if it wobbles alot to turn it on when they are lined up, this will minimize the wobble and Dock them up.

4 - All RV is the same no matter where you are [Orbiting that is]

Just Remember, Quick Save is your Friend! Don't be afraid to hit that F5 key often. That way if you Burn the wrong way, or make what ever mistake, you can just Reload and learn from your Mistakes.

I hope that helped abit more. Let us know if your still having troubles. It's late here but tomorrow I might get some time to get some Screenshots. Pictures always tell a better story than my babbling!
